intro: Endotropis, commonly known as the common morning glory, is a genus of flowering plants in the Convolvulaceae family. It is characterized by its climbing habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in the morning. The leaves are usually heart-shaped and opposite, while the stems are hairy and twining. Endotropis species are native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. They are often cultivated for their ornamental value and have been used in traditional medicine in some cultures.
